results.title: The Will to Win
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Seven Dimensions and Eve Ash
results.brief_description: Ron Barassi outlines a five point strategy for setting and achieving goals that relate to career plans, study, ambitions, sports, work and fitness.

results.title: The Will is not enough
results.creator_credit: Peter Jarvis, Howard Smith and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Middle East”.
The growth of Arab nationalism provided a base for President Nasser in his attempt to achieve Arab unity. Having dealt with the uniting of a vast number of peoples through Islam, the film considers the decline of the Ottoman Empire, the Imperial conquests of the European powers and the first Nationalist Movements that appeared within the Arab world. Newsreel footage from the 1920’s, 1930’s and 1950’s is used.

results.title: The Wildlife of Macquarie Island
results.creator_credit: Norman Laird and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: A picture of the wildlife on Macquarie Island stressing the harshness of the environment, where one creature preys mercilessly on another. Seaweeds and lichens; elephant seals; cormorants, sea vultures and skuas; black-browed albatross and many species of penguin are seen in the struggle for existence. The savagery of birds of prey is demonstrated as vultures stand by at the birth of a baby seal.

results.title: The Wilderness world of Sigurd F. Olson
results.creator_credit: Steve A Kahlenbeck, Ray J. Christensen and Filmedia
results.brief_description: An exploration of the creative response to nature of America’s foremost interpretive naturalist, Sigurd F. Olson. He talks about the challenges and joys of writing, and the wilderness areas of Canada and the northern United States, with film of the dramatic changing seasons of this area.

results.title: The Wildcat
results.creator_credit: Bert Haanstra, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes the techniques involving in well drilling - the erection of the derrick; the drilling at appropriate speeds through different formations; the hauling out and running in of formations; the hauling out and running in of the drill string; and the sealing and cementing of the various strings of casing. Work goes on night and day, involving at times great strain and tension. Finally, the flow tubing is run in, and gun perforation at the level of the producing formation allows oil to flow into the tubing and up the well.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bert Haanstra, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Shell Film Unit

results.title: The Wild Party
results.brief_description: Wild girls at a college pay more attention to parties than their classes. But when one party girl, Stella Ames, goes too far at a local bar and gets in trouble, her professor has to rescue her.

constellations_other.name: Sound and cinema
constellations_other.description: Beginning with one of the first films to be screened at the Palais (a Melbourne cinema with its own outstanding resident orchestra) the constellation celebrates sound as an integral part of the connection between moving image work and audience.

constellations_other.name: Boom mics, Clara Bow and musicals
constellations_other.description: The microphone was called the "terror of the studios" when sound films were introduced in the late 1920s, but after initial resistance Hollywood fully embraced the new technology.

results.description: Wild girls at a college pay more attention to parties than their classes. But when one party girl, Stella Ames, goes too far at a local bar and gets in trouble, her professor has to rescue her. Gossip linking the two escalates until Stella proves she is decent by shielding an innocent girl and winning the professor’s respect.
description_for_label: Wild girls at a college pay more attention to parties than their classes. But when one party girl, Stella Ames, goes too far at a local bar and gets in trouble, her professor has to rescue her. Gossip linking the two escalates until Stella proves she is decent by shielding an innocent girl and winning the professor’s respect.

results.title: The Wild one [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Laslo Benedek, Stanley Kramer and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A group of youths in a motorcycle gang ride into a small Californian town and begin to terrorize the locals. Johnny, the leader of the gang, falls in love with a woman in town but any hope for their relationship is ruined by both the aggression of his fellow bikers, and the prejudices and closed-mindedness of the town’s people. “The Wild one” is one of many Hollywood movies to represent the emerging sub-cultures of alienated and dissatisfied Western youth who were the immediate predecessors to the generation in the sixties who were to create the upheaval of the “counter- culture”. Initially banned in Australia on its release, “The Wild one” is also notable for Marlon Brando’s electrifying performance as Johnny and its (then) innovative use of a rock and roll music score.

results.title: The Wild Duck
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Phillip Emanuel and Film Bancor of Aust
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Henrik Ibsen about the fortunes of a loving family - the ineffectual loving father whose pride and dreams conceal a life of poverty and failure, his practical wife and their beautiful and faithful young daughter. The family is broken apart when deceived by the misplaced idealism of another person. Stars Liv Ullman and Jeremy Irons.

results.title: The Wild cell
results.creator_credit: Aram Boyajian, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Reviews what is known about the causes, diagnoses and treatments of cancer. Uses photo- micrography, animation, and multi-screen techniques to show how cancer effects and spreads through the body

results.title: The Wild bunch [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Phil Feldman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In 1913, a gang known as “The Wild Bunch”, rode into a Texas border town disguised as U.S. soldiers. Silently they entered the railroad office and robbed it. Perched on the rooftops above was a ring of hired gunmen waiting for their prey. When the gang emerged they opened fire. An exciting, provocative and influential film that breathed new life into Westerns, it brings together an all-star cast of fine actors at the peak of their talents to play the band of magnificent losers in a dying, lawless West. A documentary, “The Wild Bunch: an album in montage”, as well as a new introduction by Ernest Borgnine precedes the movie.
